action.action-desc: Mr. Clay introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To require the Federal Insurance Office to carry out a study on illegal steering and redlining in the insurance industry.

section.header: Study on insurance steering and redlining

subsection.text: The Director of the Federal Insurance Office shall carry out a study to determine whether the insurance industry is engaging in the illegal practices of insurance steering or redlining. In carrying out such study, the Director shall investigate insurance products, pricing, promotions, and placement of services being offered to consumers in the United States.
Not later than the end of the 180-day period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act, the Director shall issue a report to the Congress containingâ€”

paragraph.text: all findings and determinations made in carrying out the study required under subsection (a); and
any legislative recommendations the Director may determine appropriate.
